subject: Re: Website Build Out: Big Barber website

full_threads.body: Reminder to myself: Allie to do tomorrow

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena

full_threads.body:
Hi Big Barber team!

I saw the support request for site access.

Just checking - is this to:
1. Give Visual Web a hand with updates below, or
2. Fully move the site?

That'll help us support you properly.

If you're planning to move the site, just beware of the plugins you or the agency will need (I've outlined this below for context).

Let us know how you'd like to move forward - we're happy to help either way.

Thanks,
Andy

***

Big Barber premium plugins (annual approx):
  1. Astra Pro - $70
  2. Elementor Pro - $90
  3. Gravity Forms - $100 - $300
  4. Imagify - $75
  5. Jet Elements / Jet Engine / Jet Smart Filters - $65 each
  6. Elfsight Widgets - $36

On Tue, Aug 19, 2025 at 8:15 PM Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi all,

Thanks for your note. Just confirming the smaller updates are all taken care of:
  1. Instagram feed added
  2. TikTok added to socials
  3. About page updated
  4. Locations updated to "30+" (with QA now complete to ensure consistency across all pages)
For the e-commerce integration and franchise page updates, we're good to proceed.

These were included in the original proposal. Here's the link again to review and sign so we can lock in the work: Website & Ecommerce Upgrade

On timeline - we can certainly try to complete within 2 weeks however there are a number of moving pieces in the ecommerce set-up to be aware of and to meet this goal, it will be important we get timely feedback.

Once the deposit is paid we'll get scheduled and underway.

Thanks again,
Andy

On 17 Mar 2025, at 6:34 pm, Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:

﻿
Hi All,

Thanks for the meeting this afternoon.

We're excited to help Big Barber grow its online presence.

Based on our discussion, below is a summary of the items we can work on, along with a high-level quote to complete the investment.

Our team is confident we could get the immediate actions done in the next 2 weeks, and the bigger pieces within the next 4 weeks.

Your current Wolf IQ plan covers 2 hours each month, so would be tracked and added as overages in developer time at $109 per hour. We estimated the total work will be 27 hours.

Let me know if this works and our team can get underway.

Thanks,
Andy

***

Immediate actions (approx 10 hours)
  1. Improve homepage design [2 hours]
    1. Make clear walk-in availability
  2. Update forms for locations [2 hours]
    1. Contact routing by location
    2. Ensure notifications set-up to route correctly
    3. Would a 'lost and found' section be helpful here?
  3. Add social proof to home page [3 hours]
    1. Add Google Reviews display
    2. Highlight quotes from customer
  4. Adding testimonial videos once video [3 hours]
    1. Assuming new section on homepage
These are quick updates which we can get done in the next 1-2 weeks.

We would get our design team to create and send them to you before implementing on the website.

For the two bigger pieces [approx 17 hours]
  1. E-commerce integration [approx 12 hours]
    1. Migrate 16 products and variations from Shopify to WooCommere (5 hrs)
    2. Setup shop, single pages, cart and checkout (5 hrs)
    3. Payment Gateway setup and QA (assuming you use Stripe - 2 hour)
  2. Franchise page redesign [approx 5 hours]
    1. Design and build out franchise page
    2. Will use Guzman as example
We would get our design team to create and send them to you before implementing on the website. Existing orders that are in progress should be fulfilled (as difficult to migrate mid-order).

----


--

Andy Crebar

CEO
0404 507 555
andy@wolfiq.com

<Screenshot 2025-08-05 at 2.11.17 pm.png>
